case_vignette:
A 65-year-old male presents to dermatology clinic for evaluation of multiple spots on the face present since adolescence but increasing in number. His past medical history is remarkable for multiple pulmonary cysts, spontaneous pneumothorax and renal cell carcinoma. He reports a positive family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent pneumothorax. Physical examination reveals multiple light hypopigmented to skin colored dome shaped papules on the face and pedunculated hyperpigmented papules on the neck and axilla.  The patient is a 65-year-old female who presents to dermatology clinic for evaluation of multiple spots on the face present since adolescence but increasing in number. Her past medical history is remarkable for multiple pulmonary cysts, spontaneous pneumothorax and renal cell carcinoma. She reports a positive family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent pneumothorax. Physical examination reveals multiple light hypopigmented to skin colored dome shaped papules on the face and pedunculated hyperpigmented papules on the neck and axilla.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple spots on my face that have been there since my teenage years and they seem to be increasing in number. Additionally, I have similar but darker colored spots on my neck and axilla.
Have the spots on your face, neck, and axilla changed in color, size, or texture recently?
The spots on my face have remained light colored and skin-colored, but their number is increasing. The spots on my neck and axilla are darker and have also been increasing in number.
Do you experience any other symptoms such as bumps, itching or pain in these areas?
No, I do not experience any itching or pain in these areas.
Do you have any family members with similar skin conditions or any known genetic disorders?
Yes, I have a family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent pneumothorax.
Have you or any family member been diagnosed with a specific medical condition related to the skin issues and other symptoms you described?
I have been diagnosed with multiple pulmonary cysts, spontaneous pneumothorax, and renal cell carcinoma, and similar conditions have been noted in my family history.
Final Diagnosis: Birt-Hogg-Dubé syndrome.
